result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew J Marshall

records.addlTxt: Exhibit 1
Arraignment on November 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:00 PM 22CF95/22CM127 - Defendant Matthew J Marshall in court, in custody.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Officer Barr provides the court with a letter from MM. Court review the letter and states that the letter is in RE: to motion for discovery and request for a speedy trial. Court asks if MM would like an attorney to represent him. Court goes over this right to an attorney and speaks about the public defenders office along with forfeiting his right to an attorney which has been done already. Court speaks about competency exam and letters that have been filed. 

Court states that we will 

Attorney Harper calls Deputy Gerber. Deputy sworn and testimony given. Questioned by Attorney Harper. Court asks if MM would like to question the deputy; no response from MM. Court asks if MM has any witnesses; no response from MM.

State asks for bind over. Court finds probable cause and binds over for trial. 

Court speaks about MM request to move the trial up. Court declines to move the schedule jury trial up.

Court sets 22CM127 for trial in January. Attorney Harper speaks about filing a felony bail jump case and dismissing the CM case. State speaks that the CM case will take 1 day. Court sets jury selection for 01/09/22 at 9 am, and final status for 12/20/22 at 2 PM.

Court sets arraignment in the CF case for 11/09/22 at 2:30 PM.
Papers that were received during the 10/13/22 hearing

2:31 PM 22CF95/22CM127 - Defendant Matthew J Marshall in court; in custody.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court speaks about the prior hearing and the right to an attorney. Court asks if MM has called the public defender office. 
MM doesn't respond to the Judge's question. Court state that MM is competent and has been examined. 
MM is provided a note pad. Court speaks about forfeiting his right to have an attorney if he doesn't corporate with the court. 
Court also speak about waiver to an attorney and how the court will need to have communication with him.
Court asks if MM would like to have an attorney. MM doesn't respond or write anything down.
Attorney Harper asks that this be set for a preliminary hearing.
Court Officer provides the court with a written response. MM wrote "please deliver this documents to the judge."
Court states that the documents are three pages from the criminal complaint. The last page there are notes that were wrote by MM. On the blank side of the criminal complaint MM has written a letter to the court.
Court review the letter and in the letter is speaks about some max penalties and proposes a settlement agreement.
On the bottom of this letter MM writes that he wants a speedy trial and enter a plea.
Court will share this letter with the State.
Court is wanting to set this for a preliminary hearing and will put this on the trial calendar. 
Court explains what it means to waive your right to an attorney.
Court once again explains MM options to get an attorney one by calling the public defender office, or petitioning the court.
If MM does not do these thing then the court can forfeit your right to an attorney.

Court finds at this time; MM is forfeiting his right to an attorney. 
Court does state that  if at anytime MM decides to get representation; he can.
Attorney Harper will provide an offer to MM in writing. 

Court will set 22CF95 for trial first.
State asks for a day.
Court accepts the written jury demand.
Court will set a two day jury trial and make this a number 1.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Final status/scheduling conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on November 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial on December 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
1 - Written Responses from MM on 10/06/22
from def. re counsel and scheduling
Addressed to DA Harper from Matthew Marshall

10:00 AM 22CF95/22CM127 - Defendant Matthew J Marshall in court, in custody.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Court speaks about the competency exam and notes that the reports have come back that MM is not incompetent. Court reads part of the report. Attorney Harper asks that the court find MM as competent. MM writes a written response to the Judge. Court finds the MM waives his right to be heard on his competency. Court finds him competent. 

Court directs the MM to contact the public defenders office. Court states that the court will not appoint an attorney for him since the court believes that MM would be able to get representation through the public defenders office. If MM doesn't do that then the court will find the MM give up his right for counsel. 

Attorney Harper speaks that yesterday she had asks dispatch to ask MM to call the public defenders office after receiving a letter from MM.  Court review the letter.

Court asks if MM will be getting assistance from the SPD. MM doesn't respond and hasn't written anything down. 

MM writes that he would like a speedy trial. 

Court resets.
Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on October 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Clerk has contacted the DHS and was informed that no new order is needed; DHS is tracking the case. RCSD stated that no paper work is need for them and that they were notified that there is a bed open and working on transport.

11:18 AM 22CF95 / 22CM127 - Defendant Matthew J Marshall appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Court speaks about the report that was filed on 08/19/22. Court state the the report indicates that Mr. Marshall would not speak to the doctor. Doctor does recommend that MM be committed. Court speaks to MM. MM doesn't respond but jailer can hear the court.

Court orders in person assessment in the State Mental Health Facility on both cases. This order is forthwith. RCSD will transport the defendant to the facility when a bed is open. 

Attorney Harper is going to provide the report to MM.
Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on October 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Competency hearing on September 1, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Reset competency hearing to allow more time to complete competency evaluation.
to Judge McDougal RE: extension
For Competency

1:31 PM 22CF95, Unfiled - Defendant Matthew J Marshall in court.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Harper indicates that she has filed the complaint. Court speaks about the prior hearing. Court questions MM. MM doesn't respond.  Court has courtroom security bring up MM. 

02:06 PM - Attorney Forehand appears for Attorney Harper due to multiple courtrooms going on at the same times. MM has been brought up to the courtroom. Court indicates that MM is choosing to not speak to the court. Court will orders competency on the unfiled case know that it is being push through the system. Attorney Forehand states the max penalties on the unfiled case that is in the process of being filed with the clerk. 

Clerk is advise to set next date on the unfiled case to 08/17/22 at 3:30 pm.
For Competency Examination by Dept of Health Services
Status conference on August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:36 PM 22CF95/Unfiled - Defendant Matthew J Marshall appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Harper speaks about the B/R Packet in 22CF95 and the unfiled case. Attorney Harper states that she has spoken about members of the family; which has spoke about mental health. Attorney Harper is not raising competency. MM hasn't called the public defenders office. Victim spoke. Court advises MM to call the public defenders. MM asks what will happen if he doesn't call the public defenders office. Court raises competency in 22CF95. 

MM doesn't recall receiving the complaint. Court states that it was dropped off at dispatch. Max penalties stated. 

Unfiled case and 22CF95 will also be set for 08/05 at 8:45 AM
Competency hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Competency hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
